TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content: That when you stop playing after a few days. You get depressed easily. Yeah. KSP withdrawls are no fun.
When you start to reach for time warp while playing particularly tedious segments of other games. (True Story)

for delta-vee.

I know but what is it exactly?
When the word "Moon" is no longer a part of your lexicon, and it is completely replaced with MÃƒÂ¼n.

When you're stoked by the fact that on the FRC team you mentor, at least three of the students are into KSP, and you're annoyed by a few who aren't.

When real Solar System objects seem weird and Kerbol System objects are more normal.

When you want to treat static images on the news like map view (WHY YOU NO PAN AND TILT!), especially if it's a space-themed story.

I know but what is it exactly?

The amount of speed you would gain in vacuum, if you burned a certain quantity of fuel with a certain specific impulse.

When you're looking at a photo and you're frantically dragging over the screen with your right mouse button to look at it from the other side.

Admit it, you've all been there.

The amount of speed you would gain in vacuum, if you burned a certain quantity of fuel with a certain specific impulse.

but what dose the LN in the formula mean?

Natural logarithm. It's like regular (base 10) logarithm, but with base e (Euler's number) instead.

Edit: of course, if you work with physics, a lot of time base e seems the normal one and it's the base 10 that's weird.

Edited November 12, 2013 by Ravenchant

but what dose the LN in the formula mean?

This isn't really the thread for this discussion. There's a great Wikipedia article on Delta V and dozens if not hundreds of threads on this forum about it.

To get back in the theme of the thread, you've played too much KSP if you can describe what Delta-V is without referencing the above article.
You know you play too much KSP when you stay up from 11 pm to 11 am designing and launching a multi-part mission. Yes, I said mission. As in multiple spacecrafts sent up, not docked to a main craft.

This isn't really the thread for this discussion. There's a great Wikipedia article on Delta V and dozens if not hundreds of threads on this forum about it.

To get back in the theme of the thread, you've played too much KSP if you can describe what Delta-V is without referencing the above article.

I agree- the point was I had the Rocket Equation written on my to-do list whiteboard.
When you become abscessed with a friends Apple computer cause it has a rocket on the launchpad icon...
When you see a mobile phone tower and it reminds you of a space probe antenna!
When you try to scroll down the KSP forums with a right click and drag.
It's probably bad that I'm having KSP epiphanies at 3 a.m. when I should be sleeping... 'Zounds! The crew I'm sending to Duna has too many Kerbonauts for the recovery vehicle!'..

You know you play too much KSP when you can launch into a near perfect circular orbit with a single burn.

or When you try and find mods to make it harder. O.O
When you try to spoiler your images in the forums
...I've tried that so many times it's not funny...(why can't we anyway?)

When you're looking at a photo and you're frantically dragging over the screen with your right mouse button to look at it from the other side.

Admit it, you've all been there.

Yes. I have. Been doing that for when others do a live streams too.

Yes. I have. Been doing that for when others do a live streams too.

this... you won't believe how many times...

this... you won't believe how many times...

I know it is way worse for when it is a live game.

when jeb duplicates himself...

don't ask how.
My desktop wallpaper is a photo of Soyuz. Today I try to right click and drag to see her from other angle.
When you watch kerbal porn
